conclusion: Conductor rod ab has length 4L, rotates with angular velocity ω around point O, point a is very close to O, uniform magnetic field B perpendicular to the plane, need to find potential difference U_ab
Problem involves electromagnetic induction, EMF induced due to Lorentz force acting on free charges in conductor
Divide rod into differential elements and calculate EMF contribution from each element
Set up coordinate system with distance from point O along rod as x, rod extends from x ≈ 0 (point a) to x = 4L (point b)
Calculate linear velocity at each point: v(x) = ω * x
Calculate EMF contribution from each element: dU = Bωx dx
Integrate to find total potential difference: U_ab = ∫(0 to 4L) Bωx dx
Perform integration: U_ab = Bω [x^2/2] from 0 to 4L
Potential difference between points a and b is U_ab = 8BωL^2, with point b at higher potential than point a
